meanings.definition: The process by which light is detected by the eye.
meanings.sent1: Photoreceptions help us see things clearly in bright light.
meanings.sent2: Her photoreceptions were so sensitive that she could see in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The photoreceptions in my eyes must be on vacation today; everything looks blurry.
meanings.sent4: His photoreceptions were like tiny cameras capturing every detail of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained that photoreceptions are like the eye's own light sensors.

meanings.definition: The ability to perceive light and color.
meanings.sent1: His photoreceptions allowed him to enjoy the vibrant colors of the sunset.
meanings.sent2: She had a keen sense of photoreceptions, noticing even the subtlest changes in light.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could borrow your photoreceptions for a day to see the world through your eyes.
meanings.sent4: The artist's photoreceptions transformed ordinary light into a masterpiece of color.
meanings.sent5: The magic of photoreceptions is how they paint the world in hues of light and shadow.

meanings.definition: The cells in the retina that are sensitive to light.
meanings.sent1: The photoreceptions in the back of the eye help us see shapes and movement.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study photoreceptions to understand how our eyes process visual information.
meanings.sent3: I imagine the photoreceptions in my eyes as tiny light detectors, always at work.
meanings.sent4: The photoreceptions in her retina sparkled like tiny stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The delicate photoreceptions in the eye are nature's own light detectors.
